title: Executive Order 13299-Interagency Group on Insular Areas
content: By the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States of America, it is hereby ordered as follows:

Section 1. Interagency Group on Insular Areas. (a) There is established, within the Department of the Interior for administrative purposes, the Interagency Group on Insular Areas (IGIA). The group shall consist exclusively of:
Sec. 2. Functions of the IGIA. The IGIA shall:
seeks their individual advice and does not involve collective judgment or consensus advice or deliberation; and

Sec. 4. Judicial Review. This order is intended only to improve the internal management of the Federal Government and is not intended to, and does not, create any right or benefit, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or equity by a party against the United States, its departments, agencies, instrumentalities or entities, its officers or employees, or any other person.

GEORGE W. BUSH
The White House,
May 8, 2003.
[Filed with the Office of the Federal Register, 10:47 a.m., May 9, 2003]
citation: George W. Bush, Executive Order 13299-Interagency Group on Insular Areas Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/217169
